titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1053: Biblia sacra

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Bible in 2 volumes (Old and New Testament) with prologues. The Interpretation of Hebrew names (in the same hand as the Bible) and highly abbreviated capitula lists for most of the Old Testament (in a slightly larger, less formal hand) follow the New Testament.

msItem.title: Prologue and Book of Tobit, f. 177r [=178r] (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Judith, f. 180v [=181v] (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Esther, f. 185r [=186r] (V.1)
First and second prologue to Proverbs, f. 219r [=220r] (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Ecclesiasticus, f. 237r (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Jeremiah, f. 269v (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Baruch, f. 291v (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Ezekiel, f. 294r (V.1)
Second prologue and Book of Hosea, f. 322v (V.1)
Prologues and Book of Amos, f. 326v (V.1)
Prologue to Obadiah (Book of Obadiah and Book of Jonah, Chapters 1 and 2 missing), f. 328v (V.1)
Prologues and Book of Nahum, f. 331r (V.1)
Prologues and Book of Zephaniah, f. 333r (V.1)
Prologues and Book of Malachi, f. 338r (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Maccabbees 1, f. 339v (V.1)
Prologue and Book of Matthew, f. 1r (V.2)
Prologue and Book of Luke, f. 21v (V.2)
Prologue to the Epistles of Paul, f. 44v (V.2)
Prologue and Epistle to the Romans, f. 45r (V.2)
Prologue and Epistle to the Corinthians 1, f. 50r (V.2)
Prologue to the Canonical Epistles, f. 84r (V.2)
Prologue and Epistle to Peter 1 (Chapter 5 of Peter 1, Peter 2, and beginning of John 1 missing), f. 85v (V.2)

supportDesc.extent: 2 v. (360, 140 leaves) : 149 x 102 (99 x 73) mm. bound to 160 x 113 mm
supportDesc.foliation: V.1: Parchment, 360; 1-97a, 97b-359; V.2: Parchment, 140; 1-121a, 121b-128a, 128b-138; modern pencil foliation, lower left verso.

layoutDesc.layout: Bible written in 2 columns of 50 lines; Interpretation of Names written in 3 columns of 50 lines; capitula lists written in 3 columns of 46-49 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Puzzle initials at the beginning of each book, with flourishing, and three with faces as part of their ornamentation (v. 1, f. 1r, 3v; v. 2, f. 1r); red and blue minor initials, with contrasting flourishing; red and blue running titles and chapter numeration. The use of teal for the contrasting flourishing of red initials suggests English origins. There are a number of errors in the rubrication.

binding.p: Stamped leather with remnants of two braided leather ties on the lower cover of each volume.

origin.p: Probably written in England in the 13th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by John Hinely (signature, v. 1, f. 32r).
Formerly owned by Albert May Todd (bookplate, v.1, inside upper cover).

Yarnall Library of Theology, St. Clement's Church (Philadelphia, Pa.) (bookplate, v.1, f. i recto); pencil note on the page before the text in each volume suggests the Yarnall Library acquired the Bible from Albright in 1942 (f. iii recto).
Deposited with the Yarnall Library at the University of Pennsylvania, 1974.
